name: WithThreeJS
description: Extension for GDevelop to create simple 3D scenes.
This extension is intended for easy and simple 3D rendering. It does not currently aim for realistic 3D rendering.
## ‚ö†Ô∏è Notes on updating from version 1.x.x to version 2.0.0
The "Create 3D Scene", "Load 3D Texture", "Play 3D Sound" and "Create 3D Light" actions have been updated in version 2.0.0.
The previous actions with the same names still work but are deprecated. (Look for the ‚ö†Ô∏è icon in the event.) Please use the new actions with the same names.
Currently, I'm doing development in between jobs, but if many people support me, I will be able to devote more time to the development.

If you enjoy this extension, please consider [downloading the Example project file](https://pandako.itch.io/with-threejs-extension-for-gdevelop) to maintain this extension. (The Example project file will surely help you.üòâ)

events.comment: This is required to import the Tween.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a 3D Scene and initialize all 3D Cameras.
eventsFunctions.name: Create3DScene
eventsFunctions.sentence: ‚ö†Ô∏è Create 3D Scene V1 (Background: _PARAM1_, _PARAM2_, Ambient: _PARAM3_, Fog: _PARAM4_, _PARAM5_, _PARAM6_, Projection Scale: _PARAM7_, View Mode: _PARAM8_)

inlineCode: Please add an "Enable WithThreeJS" object to a scene.
For more information, please click here.`;
let AllCams, Camera1, Camera2, Camera3, Camera4;

parameters.description: Background Image (GDevelop Resource Name) ("" => No Background Image)
parameters.longDescription:
Escape is required. example: "assets\\Image.png" -> "assets\\\\Image.png"  
"" => No Background Image  
Image ratio 2:1 (e.g. 1024 x 512 pixels) => Skybox  
Other image ratio => Flat Background Image
parameters.name: BackGroundImage

parameters.longDescription: Distance to start applying fog.
parameters.name: FogNear

parameters.longDescription: Distance to maximum fog.
parameters.name: FogFar

parameters.longDescription:
Only affects WithThreeJS Behaviors and WithThreeJS Custom Objects.  
Affects X, Y, Z and Width, Height, Depth.
parameters.name: ProjectionScale

parameters.longDescription:
Only affects WithThreeJS Behaviors and WithThreeJS Custom Objects.  
Top Down: 2D[X, Y, Z-Order] -> 3D[X, Z-Order, Y] or Side: 2D[X, Y, Z-Order] -> 3D[X, -Y, Z-Order]
parameters.name: ViewMode

eventsFunctions.description:
Create a 3D Scene and initialize all 3D Cameras.
The second parameter is the background image.
Background image ratio 2:1 (e.g. 1024 x 512 pixels) => Skybox.
Other image ratio => Flat background image.
No image specified => No Background Image.

eventsFunctions.sentence: üèûÔ∏èCreate 3D Scene (Background: _PARAM1_, _PARAM2_, Ambient: _PARAM3_, Fog: _PARAM4_, _PARAM5_, _PARAM6_, Projection Scale: _PARAM7_, View Mode: _PARAM8_)

For more information, please click here.`;

Only affects WithThreeJS Behaviors and WithThreeJS Custom Objects.

eventsFunctions.description:
Clear 3D Scene. Removes all 3D Objects in the 3D Scene.
As a result, this action also removes 2D Objects that have 3D Projection Behaviors.
This action does not clear the loaded 3D Texture data and the loaded 3D Model data.
They will continue to be accessible by ID.
eventsFunctions.name: Clear3DScene

eventsFunctions.description: Load image from GDevelop resources and create 3D Texture.

eventsFunctions.description:
Do a Raycast.
You can get the count of 3D Objects in the result with the "Raycast Result Count" expression.
The result can be accessed via the "Raycast Result Number" expression or the "Raycast Result String" string expression.
eventsFunctions.name: Raycast

inlineCode: const From = new THREE.Vector3(FromX, FromY, FromZ);
const To = new THREE.Vector3(ToX, ToY, ToZ);

eventsFunctions.description:
Do a Raycast from the 3D Camera.
You can get the count of 3D Objects in the result with the "Raycast Result Count" expression.
The result can be accessed via the "Raycast Result Number" expression or the "Raycast Result String" string expression.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastFrom3DCamera

eventsFunctions.description:
Do a Raycast from the 3D Object. (Z axis direction)
You can get the count of 3D Objects in the result with the "Raycast Result Count" expression.
The result can be accessed via the "Raycast Result Number" expression or the "Raycast Result String" string expression.
eventsFunctions.name: RaycastFrom3DObject
Place3DObjectUsingRaycastResult

eventsFunctions.name: Create3DSprite
eventsFunctions.sentence: ‚ú®Create 3D Sprite (ID: _PARAM1_, X: _PARAM2_, Y: _PARAM3_, Z: _PARAM4_, Scale: _PARAM5_, Texture: _PARAM6_, Œ±Test: _PARAM7_, Opacity: _PARAM8_, Blend: _PARAM9_)

inlineCode: const Material = new THREE.SpriteMaterial({map:Texture, transparent:Transparent, alphaTest:AlphaTest, blending:Blend, opacity:Opacity});

parameters.longDescription: Recommended value: 1
parameters.name: Scale

parameters.longDescription:
Recommended values: 0 or 0.5  
If the texture is opaque, you can set the value to 0 to reduce the drawing load.
parameters.name: AlphaTest

parameters.longDescription:
1 is fully opaque.  
If the object is opaque, you can set the value to 1 to reduce the drawing load.
parameters.name: Opacity

parameters.longDescription: One Texture ID per line. Requires 1 or 6 Texture IDs. 3D Object with 6 textures increase the drawing load.
parameters.name: TextureIdList

parameters.longDescription:
Recommended values: 0 or 0.5  
If the texture is opaque, you can set the value to 0 to reduce the drawing load.  
The same value is set for multiple textures.
parameters.name: AlphaTest

parameters.longDescription:
1 is fully opaque.  
If the object is opaque, you can set the value to 1 to reduce the drawing load.  
The same value is set for multiple textures.
parameters.name: Opacity

parameters.longDescription: The same value is set for multiple textures.
parameters.name: Blend

‚ö†Ô∏è 3D Lights are highly loaded.
3D Directional Light and 3D Spot Light emit light in the -Z direction.
3D Lights can be handled like 3D Objects.

parameters.longDescription:
For Point and Spot Lights.  
0 is no limit.
parameters.name: Distance

parameters.longDescription:
For Spot Lights.  
The narrower the angle, the better the shadow quality.  
If it is a multiple of 90, the shadow will not be cast correctly.
parameters.name: SpotAngle

parameters.longDescription: For Spot Lights.
parameters.name: SpotPenumbra

parameters.longDescription: ‚ö†Ô∏è This is expensive and requires tweaking to get shadows looking right.
parameters.name: CastShadow

parameters.longDescription: The larger the map, the better the shadow quality, but the greater the load.
parameters.name: ShadowMapSize

parameters.longDescription:
The smaller the range, the better the shadow quality.  
For Point and Spot Lights, this value is valid only if the Distance is 0.
parameters.name: ShadowRange

parameters.longDescription:
It is mainly effective for filling gaps between objects and shadows.  
Reference value: [Directional Light: 0.002] [Point Light: 0.001] [Spot Light: 0.00001]
parameters.name: ShadowDepthBias

parameters.longDescription:
It is mainly effective in reducing striped patterns.  
Reference value: [Directional Light: 2] [Point Light: 1] [Spot Light: 1]
parameters.name: ShadowNormalBias

eventsFunctions.description:
Remove a 3D Object from the 3D Scene.
This action cannot remove 3D Objects created by 3D Projection Behaviors.
This action does not clear the loaded 3D Texture data and the loaded 3D Model data.
They will continue to be accessible by ID.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the visibility of a 3D Object.

parameters.longDescription:
The visibility of a child 3D Object that has been changed by inheritance cannot be changed individually.  
Similarly, the visibility of an individually changed child 3D Object cannot be changed by inheritance.

eventsFunctions.description:
Change the Opacity of a 3D Object.
The same value is set for multiple textures.

parameters.longDescription: 1 is fully opaque.

eventsFunctions.description:
Change the Scale of a 3D Object.
Note that 3D Sprite and 3D Model were scaled when created.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeScale

eventsFunctions.description:
Change the DepthWrite of a 3D Object.
Whether rendering this 3D Object has any effect on the depth buffer.
If transparent 3D Objects overlap and render incorrectly, you may be able to obtain ideal rendering results by setting the DepthWrite of that 3D Object to No.
Default is Yes.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeDepthWrite

eventsFunctions.description:
Change all animations speed scale of a 3D Object.
0 is pause.
Negative values play backwards.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeAllAnimationsSpeedScale

eventsFunctions.description: Change the Blend Mode of a 3D Object.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeBlendMode

parameters.longDescription: The same value is set for multiple textures.
parameters.name: Blend

eventsFunctions.description:
Determines whether the 3D Object can be detected by Raycast.
Default is detectable (Yes).
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeRaycastDetection

eventsFunctions.description:
Resolve collisions between Bounding Boxes.
It is not necessary to use the "Check Bounding Box Collision" condition beforehand. (It will do almost the same processing)
Note that the 3D Objects are still in contact after resolution. ("Check Bounding Box Collision" condition will not be false.)
3D Object thickness too thin for the amount of movement will not resolve correctly.
This action updates the "Bounding Box Collision Result".
"Bounding Box Collision Result" stores the value when the Target 3D Object is unmoved.
eventsFunctions.name: ResolveBoundingBoxCollisionV2

inlineCode: Light = new THREE.SpotLight(`rgb(${RGB[0]}, ${RGB[1]}, ${RGB[2]})`, Intensity, Distance, gdjs.toRad(SpotAngle), SpotPenumbra, Decay);
Light = new THREE.PointLight(`rgb(${RGB[0]}, ${RGB[1]}, ${RGB[2]})`, Intensity, Distance, Decay);
const Material = new THREE.MeshBasicMaterial( {color: 0xffaa00, wireframe: true} );

propertyDescriptors.label: Distance (Default: 0)
propertyDescriptors.description: For Point and Spot Lights. 0 is no limit.
propertyDescriptors.name: Distance

propertyDescriptors.label: Spot Angle (0 to 180)
propertyDescriptors.description: For Spot Lights. The narrower the angle, the better the shadow quality. If it is a multiple of 90, the shadow will not be cast correctly.
propertyDescriptors.name: SpotAngle

propertyDescriptors.label: Spot Penumbra (0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: For Spot Lights.
propertyDescriptors.name: SpotPenumbra

propertyDescriptors.label: Cast Shadow
propertyDescriptors.description: ‚ö†Ô∏è This is expensive and requires tweaking to get shadows looking right.
propertyDescriptors.name: CastShadow

propertyDescriptors.label: Shadow Map Size
propertyDescriptors.description: The larger the map, the better the shadow quality, but the greater the load.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowMapSize

propertyDescriptors.label: Range to Draw Shadows
propertyDescriptors.description: The smaller the range, the better the shadow quality. For Point and Spot Lights, this value is valid only if the Distance is 0.
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowRange

propertyDescriptors.label: Shadow Depth Bias (Default: 0.002)
propertyDescriptors.description: It is mainly effective for filling gaps between objects and shadows. Reference value: [Directional Light: 0.002] [Point Light: 0.001] [Spot Light: 0.00001]
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowDepthBias

propertyDescriptors.label: Shadow Normal Bias (Default: 2)
propertyDescriptors.description: It is mainly effective in reducing striped patterns. Reference value: [Directional Light: 2] [Point Light: 1] [Spot Light: 1]
propertyDescriptors.name: ShadowNormalBias
